ground_truth: The older newcomer takes a seat as Purvis approaches. Horses barrel down a racetrack, jockeys crouched on their backs, while an announcer watches from a tower and onlookers crowd the rails. Among them, Billie grins, Dillinger beside her. In cheers, the horses race shoulder to shoulder. Later, outside the racetrack, Nitti and D'Andrea sit by a patio table by a grassy crowd as Nitti summons a breath, squinting in the sunlight. D'Andrea waves at Dillinger across the crowd and glances around. Later, Dillinger plumps into a chair in the grandstand with Billie sitting beside him. One row down, Pete leans closer and Homer listens too. Homer speaks up, and Dillinger faces his girlfriend, who glares at him and then drops her gaze. D'Andrea joins him and leaves, while Billie stares off. Dillinger frowns, shifts in his seat, and squarely faces Billie as she hangs her head. Billie allows a thoughtful smile, leans forward, cups the back of Dillinger's head in her hand, and presses her lips to his. He pulls away, gazes into her eyes, and kisses her again as spectators stand and cheer on the race. Now in a town, a brambly bush grows by a biro cactus and a healthy saguaro as Billie and Dillinger enter the lobby and stroll toward the front desk. A balding clerk faces them, hands Dillinger a pen, and the gang leader signs a guest register. Dillinger picks up a suitcase and heads off with Billie to a hotel room, where he opens the suitcase, takes out his Tommy gun, and cocks it. Later, he opens a window and pulls the sheer curtains closed. The gang leader takes off his suit coat and handgun, ambles to a set of closed double doors, and pushes one open to peek into a bathroom where Billie sits nude in the tub. As he opens the door all the way, she seductively slides her hands up the porcelain out of the water, then lifts one shapely leg and caresses the tub's rim with her foot, running her toes along a soap dish. As Johnny turns back to the bedroom, the door bursts open and the balding man from the front desk leads other men in, clouding Dillinger with the butt of a rifle. As another lawman handcuffs him, Billie runs out wearing a towel. Later, the lawmen lead Dillinger into a jail as more officers escort Pete and the heavyset bank robber. Pete struggles as his captors lead him away from his boss. A lawman shuts a door, showing an isolated cellblock. Inside, the officers lock Dillinger inside a holding cell and remove his handcuffs through the bars. Wearing cowboy hats, the officers head out, while Dillinger massages his wrists, gazing off. He paces forward and leans tensely on a rail attaching the cell bars one to the next.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The elder novice takes a chair as Purvis nears. Stallions dash down a course, riders huddled on their backs, while an announcer observes from a tower and spectators pack the barriers. Among them, Billie beams, Dillinger alongside her. In applause, the stallions sprint alongside one another. Later, outside the course, Nitti and D'Andrea sit by a terrace table by a grassy assembly as Nitti draws a breath, squinting in the daylight. D'Andrea gestures at Dillinger across the assembly and glances around. Later, Dillinger lounges into a seat in the grandstand with Billie sitting beside him. One row down, Pete inclines closer and Homer hears too. Homer speaks up, and Dillinger turns to his companion, who glares at him and then lowers her gaze. D'Andrea joins him and departs, while Billie gazes off. Dillinger scowls, shifts in his chair, and directly faces Billie as she lowers her head. Billie allows a contemplative grin, leans forward, cups the back of Dillinger's head in her palm, and presses her lips to his. He withdraws, looks into her eyes, and kisses her again as onlookers stand and cheer on the contest. Now in a municipality, a thorny shrub grows by a barrel cactus and a robust saguaro as Billie and Dillinger enter the foyer and stroll toward the front counter. A balding attendant faces them, hands Dillinger a pen, and the gang leader signs a guest log. Dillinger picks up a suitcase and heads off with Billie to a hotel chamber, where he opens the suitcase, takes out his Tommy gun, and cocks it. Later, he opens a window and draws the sheer drapes closed. The gang leader removes his suit coat and firearm, ambles to a set of shut double doors, and pushes one open to peek into a lavatory where Billie sits bare in the tub. As he opens the door entirely, she seductively slides her hands up the porcelain out of the water, then raises one shapely leg and caresses the tub's edge with her foot, running her toes along a soap holder. As Johnny turns back to the bedroom, the door bursts open and the balding attendant from the front counter leads other men in, clouding Dillinger with the butt of a rifle. As another officer restrains him, Billie runs out wearing a towel. Later, the officers lead Dillinger into a prison as more officers escort Pete and the corpulent bank bandit. Pete struggles as his captors lead him away from his leader. An officer shuts a door, displaying a secluded cellblock. Inside, the officers lock Dillinger inside a holding cell and remove his restraints through the bars. Wearing cowboy hats, the officers head out, while Dillinger massages his wrists, looking off. He paces forward and leans tensely on a rail connecting the cell bars one to the next.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The seat is taken by the older newcomer as Purvis approaches. A racetrack is barreled down by horses, jockeys crouching on their backs, while an announcer is watching from a tower and the rails are crowded by onlookers. Among them, a grin is flashed by Billie, with Dillinger beside her. In cheers, shoulder to shoulder, the horses are raced. Later, outside the racetrack, a patio table is occupied by Nitti and D'Andrea by a grassy crowd as a breath is summoned by Nitti, squinting in the sunlight. Dillinger is waved at by D'Andrea across the crowd and his glance is cast around. Later, a chair in the grandstand is plumped into by Dillinger with Billie sitting beside him. One row down, Pete leans closer and Homer listens too. Homer speaks up, and Dillinger faces his girlfriend, who glares at him and then her gaze is dropped. D'Andrea joins him and leaves, while Billie stares off. A frown is formed by Dillinger, he shifts in his seat, and Billie is squarely faced by him as her head is hung. A thoughtful smile is allowed by Billie, she leans forward, the back of Dillinger's head is cupped in her hand, and his lips are pressed by hers. He pulls away, her eyes are gazed into by him, and a kiss is shared again as spectators stand and cheer on the race. Now in a town, a brambly bush is grown by a biro cactus and a healthy saguaro as the lobby is entered by Billie and Dillinger, who stroll toward the front desk. A balding clerk is faced by them, a pen is handed to Dillinger, and a guest register is signed by the gang leader. A suitcase is picked up by Dillinger and Billie is headed off with him to a hotel room, where the suitcase is opened by him, his Tommy gun is taken out, and it is cocked. Later, he opens a window and closes the sheer curtains. The gang leader takes off his suit coat and handgun, ambles to a set of closed double doors, and pushes one open to peek into a bathroom where the tub is sat in by Billie. As he opens the door all the way, her hands are seductively slid up the porcelain out of the water by her, then one shapely leg is lifted and the tub's rim is caressed with her foot, running her toes along a soap dish. As Johnny turns back to the bedroom, the door is burst open and other men are led in by the balding man from the front desk, clouding Dillinger with the butt of a rifle. As another lawman handcuffs him, a towel is worn by Billie as she runs out. Later, Dillinger is led by the lawmen into a jail as Pete and the heavyset bank robber are escorted by more officers. Pete struggles as he is led away from his boss by his captors. A door is shut by a lawman, showing an isolated cellblock. Inside, Dillinger is locked inside a holding cell by the officers and his handcuffs are removed through the bars. Wearing cowboy hats, the officers head out, while his wrists are massaged by Dillinger, gazing off. He paces forward and a rail attaching the cell bars one to the next is leaned on tensely by him.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The older newcomer sits as Purvis approaches. Horses race down a track, jockeys crouched, with an announcer in a tower and onlookers crowding the rails. Among them, Billie grins with Dillinger beside her. Cheering, the horses race side by side. Later, outside, Nitti and D'Andrea are at a patio table as Nitti squints in the sun. D'Andrea waves at Dillinger and glances around. Dillinger sits in the grandstand with Billie. Pete leans closer, and Homer listens. Homer speaks up, and Dillinger faces Billie, who glares, then looks down. D'Andrea comes and leaves, while Billie stares off. Dillinger frowns and faces Billie, who smiles thoughtfully, cups his head, and kisses him. He pulls away, looks into her eyes, and kisses her again as spectators cheer. In town, a bush grows by cacti as Billie and Dillinger head to the lobby and approach the front desk. A balding clerk gives Dillinger a pen to sign the register. Dillinger grabs a suitcase, and they go to a room where he takes out and cocks his Tommy gun. He opens a window and draws the curtains. Removing his coat and handgun, he peeks into a bathroom where Billie is in the tub. She seductively slides her hands and legs on the tub, running toes along a soap dish. When Johnny turns, the door bursts open, and the balding clerk with others knocks Dillinger with a rifle butt. As another handcuffs him, Billie runs out in a towel. Later, lawmen lead Dillinger into jail as more officers escort Pete. Pete struggles as he’s led away. A lawman shuts a door, revealing an isolated cellblock. Officers lock Dillinger in a holding cell and remove his handcuffs. Wearing cowboy hats, officers leave, while Dillinger massages his wrists and gazes off. He paces and leans tensely on a rail connecting the cell bars.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The older newcomer sits as Purvis approaches. Horses race with jockeys, an announcer watches, and onlookers, including Billie and Dillinger, cheer. Outside, Nitti and D'Andrea sit as Nitti squints in the sun. D'Andrea waves at Dillinger. Later, Dillinger sits with Billie in the grandstand. Pete and Homer listen nearby. Homer speaks; Dillinger turns to Billie, who glares and looks away. D'Andrea joins and leaves them. Billie smiles, kisses Dillinger, who returns it as spectators cheer the race. In town, a brambly bush grows by cacti as Billie and Dillinger enter a hotel. A balding clerk gives Dillinger a pen to sign the guest register. Dillinger takes a suitcase to their room, opens it, removes a Tommy gun, cocks it, and shuts the curtains. He peeks into the bathroom where Billie is in the tub. She caresses the tub with her foot. As Johnny turns, the balding clerk and others burst in, subdue Dillinger, and handcuff him. Billie runs out in a towel. Lawmen lead Dillinger to jail with Pete and another robber. Pete struggles as officers lock Dillinger in a cell and remove his handcuffs. They leave, and Dillinger massages his wrists, paces, and leans on the cell bars.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: The older newcomer takes a seat at the very moment Purvis makes his approach. Horses barrel down the racetrack with impressive speed, their jockeys crouched tightly on their backs, maintaining balance and focus, while an announcer attentively observes the scene from a tower and onlookers enthusiastically crowd the rails. Among this excited crowd, Billie grins broadly with Dillinger standing right beside her. Amidst cheers and applause, the horses race powerfully, shoulder to shoulder, neck and neck. Later, outside the lively racetrack, Nitti and D'Andrea find themselves seated by a patio table next to a grassy crowd as Nitti takes a deep, deliberate breath, squinting slightly in the bright sunlight. D'Andrea waves at Dillinger across the crowd, his gaze wandering around the scene. Later, Dillinger plumps down into a chair within the grandstand with Billie comfortably sitting beside him. Just one row down, Pete leans in closer, and Homer listens intently as well. Homer speaks up, prompting Dillinger to turn towards his girlfriend, who glares at him intensely before reluctantly dropping her gaze. D'Andrea joins them briefly and then leaves, while Billie stares off into the distance. Dillinger frowns subtly, shifts uncomfortably in his seat, and directly faces Billie as she hangs her head in contemplation. Billie eventually allows a thoughtful smile to cross her lips, leans forward gently, and cups the back of Dillinger's head with her hand, pressing her lips softly against his. He pulls back slightly, gazing deeply into her eyes, before passionately kissing her again as spectators stand and cheer on the ongoing race. In a town setting, a brambly bush grows untamed by a sturdy biro cactus and a healthy saguaro, as Billie and Dillinger enter the lobby and casually stroll toward the front desk. A balding clerk faces them, handing Dillinger a pen, and the gang leader confidently signs the guest register. Dillinger then picks up a suitcase and heads off with Billie to a hotel room, where he opens the suitcase, revealing his Tommy gun, which he then expertly cocks. Later, he opens a window and gently pulls the sheer curtains closed. The gang leader methodically takes off his suit coat and handgun, ambles over to a set of closed double doors, and quietly pushes one open to peek into the bathroom where Billie sits, nude in the tub. As he opens the door fully, she seductively slides her hands up the cool porcelain, emerging from the water, then gracefully lifts one shapely leg and caresses the tub's rim with her foot, her toes lightly brushing against a soap dish. Just as Johnny turns back towards the bedroom, the door bursts open unexpectedly, and the balding man from the front desk leads several other men inside, unsettling Dillinger with the forceful butt of a rifle. As another lawman quickly handcuffs him, Billie rushes out in a flurry, wearing nothing but a towel. Later on, the lawmen lead Dillinger into a secure jail as more officers escort Pete and the heavyset bank robber. Pete struggles with all his might as his captors forcefully lead him away from his boss. A lawman shuts a heavy door, revealing an isolated cellblock. Inside this confined space, the officers lock Dillinger inside a holding cell and deftly remove his handcuffs through the bars. Wearing cowboy hats, the officers make their exit, while Dillinger massages his wrists thoughtfully, gazing off pensively. He paces forward slowly and leans tensely on a rail, which attaches the cell bars one to the next, contemplating his situation.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: The older newcomer, with a sense of curiosity and perhaps a hint of trepidation, takes a seat just as Purvis makes his timely approach. At this electrifying moment, horses thunder down the racetrack with remarkable speed and grace, while their jockeys maintain a low crouch, expertly balancing and focusing intensely, as they strive to lead the pack. An announcer diligently keeps watch over the entire vibrant scene from an elevated tower, while animated onlookers enthusiastically gather around the rails. Amongst this enthusiastic crowd, Billie’s face lights up with a broad grin, her spirits clearly lifted, as Dillinger stands right beside her, sharing in the excitement. Amidst the raucous cheers and applause, the horses compete with unmatched vigor, running shoulder to shoulder, and neck and neck in a show of thrilling competition. Later on, away from the energetic atmosphere of the racetrack, Nitti and D'Andrea find themselves comfortably seated by a patio table, positioned next to a grassy crowd. Nitti inhales deeply, pausing to take a deliberate breath while squinting slightly against the bright, relentless sunlight. Meanwhile, D'Andrea waves at Dillinger from across the bustling crowd, his curious gaze roaming around the scene. In a subsequent moment, Dillinger unceremoniously plops down into a seat within the grandstand area, with Billie sitting comfortably next to him. Just one row down, Pete leans in closer, listening intently along with Homer, who speaks up, catching Dillinger's attention. This prompts Dillinger to turn directly towards his girlfriend, who initially meets his gaze with an intense glare before letting her eyes drop reluctantly. D'Andrea makes a brief appearance, joining them for a moment before taking his leave, while Billie, lost in thought, gazes off into the distance. Dillinger frowns subtly, feeling a sense of discomfort as he shifts in his seat, and then turns to face Billie directly as she lowers her head in contemplation. Eventually, Billie allows a thoughtful smile to cross her lips, leaning forward gently, and tenderly cups the back of Dillinger's head with her hand, pressing her lips softly against his. He hesitates momentarily, pulling back slightly to gaze deeply into her eyes, before passionately kissing her once more, as the crowd around them stands and cheers on the ongoing race with fervor. In a different setting, within the quaint town, a brambly bush grows untamed by a sturdy biro cactus and a healthy saguaro. Against this backdrop, Billie and Dillinger enter the lobby, casually strolling towards the front desk. Before them stands a balding clerk, who faces them with a polite demeanor, handing Dillinger a pen with which the gang leader confidently signs the guest register in a bold flourish. Subsequently, Dillinger picks up a suitcase and heads off with Billie towards a hotel room where he opens the suitcase, unveiling his Tommy gun, which he then expertly and confidently cocks. Later, he turns his attention to the window, gently pulling the sheer curtains closed with careful precision. The gang leader then methodically removes his suit coat and handgun, taking his time as he ambles over to examine a set of closed double doors. Quietly, he pushes one door open, just enough to peek into the bathroom where Billie sits, soaking luxuriously in the tub. As he opens the door fully, she seductively slides her hands up the cool, smooth porcelain, emerging slightly from the water. She then gracefully lifts one of her shapely legs, letting it glide along the rim of the tub, while her toes lightly brush against a nearby soap dish. Just as Johnny turns back towards the bedroom, unexpectedly, the door bursts open with a sudden force. The balding man from the front desk leads several other men inside, as they unsettle Dillinger with the forceful butt of a rifle. Another lawman quickly steps in, securing Dillinger with handcuffs, as Billie rushes out in a flurry, clad in nothing but a hastily wrapped towel. Later on, the lawmen lead Dillinger into a secure, imposing jail, while more officers escort Pete and the heavyset bank robber. Pete resists fiercely, struggling with all his might as his captors forcefully lead him away from his boss. A lawman shuts a heavy, imposing door, revealing an isolated cellblock. Within this confining space, the officers lock Dillinger inside a holding cell, deftly removing his handcuffs through the steadfast bars. Donning cowboy hats, the officers make their unceremonious exit, leaving Dillinger alone to massage his wrists thoughtfully, his gaze pensive and contemplative. He slowly paces forward, leaning tensely against a rail that connects the cell bars, contemplating the weight of his current situation with intense focus.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The older newcomer, with a weary yet interested demeanor, takes a seat as Purvis approaches him with a purposeful stride, initiating an encounter that is sure to unfold with a sense of gravity. Meanwhile, at the racetrack, the scene is alive with electricity as horses thunder down the track at full speed, their jockeys expertly crouched low on their backs to minimize air resistance, while an announcer peers intently from his elevated position in the tower, narrating the unfolding events to the exhilarated crowd packed along the rails. Among the spectators, Billie beams with excitement, sharing the moment with Dillinger, who stands close beside her, both absorbed in the thrill of the race as they join in the collective cheers that erupt while the horses continue their neck-and-neck contest. The scene shifts to a quieter setting outside the racetrack where Nitti and D'Andrea sit at a patio table amidst a grassy area bustling with people. Nitti takes a deep breath, battling the glare of the sun with a squint, while D'Andrea energetically waves to Dillinger across the sea of individuals, casting glances about to ensure the message is received. Later on, Dillinger lowers himself into a chair within the grandstand, his movements deliberate, as Billie takes her seat beside him. In the row directly ahead, Pete leans in with keen interest, and Homer, too, listens attentively. As Homer voices his thoughts, Dillinger shifts his attention to his girlfriend who meets his gaze with a glare before averting her eyes downward. D'Andrea briefly joins the group and then departs, leaving Billie staring off into the distance, lost in thought. Dillinger's face clouds with a frown as he adjusts his position, resolutely turning towards Billie, who sits with her head hung, giving in to a thoughtful smile. She leans in, gently cradles the back of Dillinger's head, and tenderly kisses him. Dillinger, momentarily pulling away, looks deeply into her eyes before leaning in for another kiss, all while the spectators around them rise to their feet, their cheers serving as an exhilarating soundtrack to the race taking place. The narrative transitions to a town setting where a brambly bush coexists with a biro cactus and a robust saguaro, providing a picturesque backdrop as Billie and Dillinger amble into the lobby of a hotel, heading towards the front desk with an air of casual confidence. There, a balding clerk stands at attention, ready to assist, handing Dillinger a pen with which he signs the guest register with a confident flourish. Dillinger retrieves a suitcase and, together with Billie, proceeds to a hotel room. Upon entering, he places the suitcase on the bed, opens it with intent, and extracts his Tommy gun, checking its readiness by cocking it. Time progresses, and he approaches the window, drawing the sheer curtains to a close, cocooning themselves in privacy. With a sense of relaxation, he removes his suit coat and handgun, walking leisurely to a set of closed double doors which he pushes open to reveal the bathroom. There, Billie sits nude in the tub, exuding allure as she gracefully slides her hands along the smooth porcelain, breaks the water's surface with a shapely leg, and sensuously traces the rim of the tub with her foot, toes teasing a soap dish. As Johnny pivots to return to the bedroom, the door bursts open, shattering the moment as the balding clerk from the front desk, now accompanied by a group of men, storms in, and one swiftly incapacitates Dillinger with the rifle's butt. Amidst the chaos, another lawman cuffs Dillinger’s hands, while Billie, hastily wrapping herself in a towel, rushes out with alarm. Subsequently, the lawmen escort Dillinger into a jail, their demeanor authoritative, as additional officers usher Pete and the heavyset bank robber alongside him. Pete resists, struggling with his captors as they separate him from his boss. A lawman forcefully shuts a door, revealing an isolated cellblock that represents Dillinger's new confines. In the holding cell, Dillinger is locked in securely, the clang of metal echoing as the officers efficiently remove his handcuffs through the bars. The officers, distinct in their cowboy hats, make their exit, leaving Dillinger alone to survey his surroundings, massaging his sore wrists. He begins pacing slowly, absorbing the stark reality, and comes to rest, tensely leaning on the rail that firmly knits the cell bars together, contemplating his predicament.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
The older newcomer sits down as Purvis approaches. Horses race around a track with jockeys aboard, while an announcer oversees the scene and spectators gather at the rails, including Billie and Dillinger, who share a moment of excitement. Elsewhere, by a patio table, Nitti and D'Andrea observe the racetrack crowd, with D'Andrea signaling to Dillinger and assessing the scene. Later, Dillinger and Billie sit together in the grandstand, joined by Pete and Homer. Dillinger listens to Homer and exchanges a tense glance with Billie, who looks away. D'Andrea briefly joins them before departing, while Dillinger focuses on Billie, who eventually smiles thoughtfully and kisses him. They share a tender moment amidst the cheering race crowd. 

In town, a brambly bush grows alongside cacti as Billie and Dillinger enter a hotel. The clerk hands Dillinger a pen to sign the guest register, and they proceed to their room. Inside, Dillinger unpacks a Tommy gun from his suitcase and prepares it. He closes the curtains after opening the window, removes his coat and gun, and peeks into the bathroom where Billie is bathing. She seductively moves in the tub as Dillinger watches, but their moment is interrupted when the clerk and lawmen burst in, subduing Dillinger with a rifle butt and handcuffing him as Billie emerges in a towel.

Later, Dillinger is led into a jail alongside Pete and another bank robber. Pete is taken away separately, and Dillinger is locked in a holding cell, the officers removing his handcuffs before leaving. Dillinger massages his wrists, paces, and leans on the cell bars, contemplating his situation.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The older newcomer takes a seat as Purvis, a well-known FBI agent famous for his pursuit of notorious criminals during the 1930s, approaches. Horses barrel down a racetrack at Churchill Downs, renowned for hosting the Kentucky Derby, jockeys crouched on their backs, while an announcer watches from a tower and onlookers crowd the rails. Among them, Billie grins, Dillinger, the infamous bank robber who became a folk hero during the Great Depression, beside her. Amid cheers, the horses race shoulder to shoulder. Later, outside the racetrack in the bustling crowd, Nitti, a reputed mobster linked to Al Capone, and D'Andrea sit by a patio table by a grassy area as Nitti summons a breath, squinting in the sunlight. D'Andrea waves at Dillinger across the crowd and glances around. Later, Dillinger plumps into a chair in the grandstand with Billie sitting beside him. One row down, Pete, another member of Dillinger's gang, leans closer and Homer listens too. Homer speaks up, and Dillinger faces his girlfriend, who glares at him and then drops her gaze. D'Andrea joins him and leaves, while Billie stares off. Dillinger frowns, shifts in his seat, and squarely faces Billie, a woman known for her loyalty to him despite his criminal life, as she hangs her head. Billie allows a thoughtful smile, leans forward, cups the back of Dillinger's head in her hand, and presses her lips to his. He pulls away, gazes into her eyes, and kisses her again as spectators stand and cheer on the race. Now in Tucson, Arizona, a town famous for its desert landscape, a brambly bush grows by a biro cactus and a healthy saguaro as Billie and Dillinger enter the lobby of a historic hotel and stroll toward the front desk. A balding clerk faces them, hands Dillinger a pen, which was a luxury item at the time, and the gang leader signs a guest register. Dillinger picks up a suitcase and heads off with Billie to a hotel room, where he opens the suitcase, takes out his Tommy gun, a notorious weapon favored by gangsters, and cocks it. Later, he opens a window and pulls the sheer curtains closed. The gang leader takes off his suit coat and handgun, ambles to a set of closed double doors, and pushes one open to peek into a bathroom where Billie sits nude in the tub. As he opens the door all the way, she seductively slides her hands up the porcelain out of the water, then lifts one shapely leg and caresses the tub's rim with her foot, running her toes along a soap dish that had seen better days. As Johnny turns back to the bedroom, the door bursts open and the balding man from the front desk leads other men in, clouding Dillinger with the butt of a rifle. As another lawman handcuffs him, Billie runs out wearing a towel. Later, the lawmen lead Dillinger into a jail with high-security cells as more officers escort Pete and the heavyset bank robber. Pete struggles as his captors lead him away from his boss. A lawman shuts a door, showing an isolated cellblock rarely breached by those who enter. Inside, the officers lock Dillinger inside a holding cell and remove his handcuffs through the bars. Wearing cowboy hats, the officers, reflecting the Western fashion of the time, head out, while Dillinger massages his wrists, gazing off. He paces forward and leans tensely on a rail attaching the cell bars one to the next.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: The older newcomer takes a seat as Purvis approaches. Horses barrel down a racetrack jockeys crouched on their backs while an announcer watches from a tower and onlookers crowd the rails. Among them Billie grins Dillinger beside her. In cheers the horses race shoulder to shoulder. Later outside the racetrack Nitti and D'Andrea sit by a patio table by a grassy crowd. as Nitti summons a breath squinting in the sunlight. D'Andrea waves at Dillinger across the crowd and glances around. Later Dillinger plumps into a chair in the grandstand with Billie sitting beside him. One row down Pete leans closer and Homer listens too. Homer speaks up and Dillinger faces his girlfriend who glares at him and then drops her gaze. D'Andrea joins him and leaves while Billie stares off. Dillinger frowns shifts in his seat and squarely faces Billie as she hangs her head. Billie allows a thoughtful smile leans forward cups the back of Dillinger's head in her hand and presses her lips to his. He pulls away gazes into her eyes and kisses her again as spectators stand and cheer on the race. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Now in a town a brambly bush grows by a biro cactus and a healthy saguaro as Billie and Dillinger enter the lobby and stroll toward the front desk. A balding clerk faces them hands Dillinger a pen and the gang leader signs a guest register. Dillinger picks up a suitcase and heads off with Billie to a hotel room where he opens the suitcase takes out his Tommy gun and cocks it. Later he opens a window and pulls the sheer curtains closed. The gang leader takes off his suit coat and handgun ambles to a set of closed double doors and pushes one open to peek into a bathroom where Billie sits nude in the tub. As he opens the door all the way she seductively slides her hands up the porcelain out of the water then lifts one shapely leg and caresses the tub's rim with her foot running her toes along a soap dish. As Johnny turns back to the bedroom the door bursts open and the balding man from the front desk leads other men in clouding Dillinger with the butt of a rifle. As another lawman handcuffs him Billie runs out wearing a towel. Later the lawmen lead Dillinger into a jail. as more officers escort Pete and the heavyset bank robber. Pete struggles as his captors lead him away from his boss. A lawman shuts a door showing an isolated cellblock. Inside the officers lock Dillinger inside a holding cell and remove his handcuffs through the bars. Wearing cowboy hats the officers head out while Dillinger massages his wrists gazing off. He paces forward and leans tensely on a rail attaching the cell bars one to the next.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: The older newcomer takes a seat as Purvis approaches. Horses barrel down a racetrack jockeys crouched on their backs while an announcer watches from a tower and onlookers crowd the rails. Among them Billie grins Dillinger beside her. In cheers the horses race shoulder to shoulder. Later outside the racetrack Nitti and D'Andrea sit by a patio table by a grassy crowd. as Nitti summons a breath squinting in the sunlight. D'Andrea waves at Dillinger across the crowd and glances around. Later Dillinger plumps into a chair in the grandstand with Billie sitting beside him. One row down Pete leans closer and Homer listens too. Homer speaks up and Dillinger faces his girlfriend who glares at him and then drops her gaze. D'Andrea joins him and leaves while Billie stares off. Dillinger frowns shifts in his seat and squarely faces Billie as she hangs her head. Billie allows a thoughtful smile leans forward cups the back of Dillinger's head in her hand and presses her lips to his. He pulls away gazes into her eyes and kisses her again as spectators stand and cheer on the race. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. Now in a town a brambly bush grows by a biro cactus and a healthy saguaro as Billie and Dillinger enter the lobby and stroll toward the front desk. A balding clerk faces them hands Dillinger a pen and the gang leader signs a guest register. Dillinger picks up a suitcase and heads off with Billie to a hotel room where he opens the suitcase takes out his Tommy gun and cocks it. Later he opens a window and pulls the sheer curtains closed. The gang leader takes off his suit coat and handgun ambles to a set of closed double doors and pushes one open to peek into a bathroom where Billie sits nude in the tub. As he opens the door all the way she seductively slides her hands up the porcelain out of the water then lifts one shapely leg and caresses the tub's rim with her foot running her toes along a soap dish. As Johnny turns back to the bedroom the door bursts open and the balding man from the front desk leads other men in clouding Dillinger with the butt of a rifle. Pete struggles as his captors lead him away from his boss. A lawman shuts a door showing an isolated cellblock. Inside the officers lock Dillinger inside a holding cell and remove his handcuffs through the bars. Wearing cowboy hats the officers head out while Dillinger massages his wrists gazing off. He paces forward and leans tensely on a rail attaching the cell bars one to the next.

Horses barrel down a racetrack jockeys crouched on their backs while an announcer watches from a tower and onlookers crowd the rails. Among them Billie grins Dillinger beside her. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The young veteran hops onto a bike as Trevor hobbles over. Penguins waddle across a frozen pond, zookeepers perched on their shoulders, while a chef observes from a lighthouse and tourists line the fences. Among them, Mary giggles, Thompson beside her. In whispers, the penguins slide flipper to flipper. Later, near the frozen pond, Miller and O’Hara pick a log by a sandy blanket as Miller gulps a breeze, blinking in the moonlight. O’Hara gestures at Thompson across the blanket and scans the horizon. Later, Thompson flops into a hammock on the pier with Mary perched near him. One rung above, Greg murmurs and Ivan eavesdrops too. Ivan pipes up, and Thompson turns to his partner, who scowls at him and then lowers her eyes. O’Hara approaches him and departs, while Mary gazes away. Thompson scowls, shifts on his mat, and directly turns to Mary as she droops her head. Mary allows a puzzled grin, leans backward, rests the front of Thompson's hand in her grasp, and brushes her cheek to his. He recoils, peers into her face, and embraces her again as surfers rise and applaud the display. Now in a forest, a regal oak sprouts by a crimson elm and a sturdy birch as Mary and Thompson exit the shop and stride toward the counter. A mustached barista greets them, hands Thompson a fork, and the blacksmith scribbles a ledger. Thompson grabs a backpack and strides out with Mary to a tent, where he unzips the backpack, extracts his crossbow, and loads it. Later, he unlatches a skylight and draws the heavy curtains open. The blacksmith sheds his blazer and dagger, saunters to a pair of ajar swing doors, and nudges one aside to peek into a kitchen where Mary rests clothed in an apron. As he swings the door shut, she gracefully lowers her arms into the porcelain above the bubbles, then lowers one dainty elbow and strokes the sink’s edge with her wrist, trailing her fingers over a spice rack. As Tommy pivots back to the corridor, the window swings shut, and the mustached barista from the counter escorts other youths in, wounding Thompson with the edge of a kite. As another ranger shackles him, Mary dashes in wearing a robe. Later, the rangers escort Thompson into a barn as more scouts accompany Greg and the slender shopkeeper. Greg wriggles as his handlers steer him away from his mentor. A ranger swings a gate, revealing a segregated chicken coop. Inside, the scouts secure Thompson in an empty nest and detach his shackles through the mesh. Wearing sun hats, the scouts exit, while Thompson rubs his fingers, daydreaming. He inches backward and rests gingerly on a beam connecting the coop mesh one to the other.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The older newcomer sits as Purvis approaches. Horses race while an announcer and onlookers cheer. Billie grins with Dillinger beside her. Later, at the racetrack, Dillinger sits beside Billie. Homer speaks, causing tension between Dillinger and Billie. D'Andrea joins and leaves. Billie smiles, kisses Dillinger, and they embrace as spectators cheer. In town, Billie and Dillinger check into a hotel. Dillinger retrieves his Tommy gun from a suitcase and prepares, while Billie bathes seductively. Suddenly, a balding clerk and lawmen burst in, capturing Dillinger. Later, Dillinger is led to jail, where lawmen lock him up and leave. He massages his wrists and leans tensely on the cell bars.
